channel.title: Contemplating Renting this; Opinions? (HP Pav)
channel.description:
Just an opinion from my nerd acquaintances here. Seeing as I have a moderate understanding of hardware, I just want to get some professional views (and experiences, if you've had any) on this laptop I'm looking to rent (and its' hardware)
I'm still stuck with, what feels like, Bill Gates beta version of the first computer ever. So this is a giant upgrade for me. (This computer is only 700Mhz, 30GB HDD, 512mb Ram and a graphics card that can't even play WoW)
I haven't heard much about ATI's graphics cards, your thoughts?
http://h10010.www1.hp.com/wwpc/au/en/ho/WF06b/321957-321957-3329744-64354-64354-3884606-3938983.html

item.title: Contemplating Renting this; Opinions? (HP Pav)
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:26, topic:283836”][quote author=Cowie` link=topic=375118.msg2828810#msg2828810 date=1245238763]

Fact - Kane is a rent boy.

Someone’s upset because they can’t afford me.

Don’t be so crude, I was talking about you being someone who wishes to rent an item…
[/quote]
You bring out the best in me, sweet Cowie. x[/quote]
No problem my little treacle tart.

Read full topic

item.title: Contemplating Renting this; Opinions? (HP Pav)
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:14, topic:283836”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=375118.msg2827752#msg2827752 date=1245157144]
Buy a desktop, you will get better hardware for a cheaper price.
[/quote]
I need the mobility. It definitely has to be a laptop.[/quote]
Just get a UPS and wireless touch screen for your desktop. Shove desktop and charged UPS into suitcase and have fun

Read full topic

item.title: Contemplating Renting this; Opinions? (HP Pav)
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:25, topic:283836”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=375118.msg2828719#msg2828719 date=1245229326]

My best friend has the same laptop - He hasn’t found a game yet that it can’t handle. The graphics card is fine, I wouldn’t worry about it unless you want to play Crysis or something. (I think it can play Crysis anyway) Also, I would downgrade it to XP - Vista is a pain in the ass and CPU hogger

Or use a Linux distribution + wine/other emulators?

In his case it seems that he wants this laptop primarily for gaming - not saying that he cannot use Wine to play them, but I am not sure what games are compatible with Wine.

Not primarily, but it’d be a very nice addition. Compared to this thing anyway.
Don’t think I’d go to the hassle of installing Linux. Even though it is a preferable OS, Windows is just more friendly (ironic, I know) with most used applications and other things.

I don’t want to bother with emulators and etc.
[/quote]
Idea: Boot Linux for normal use, boot Windows for gaming?[/quote]
I appreciate the thought but I’m just so lazy.
I’m pretty sure with the specs it’ll be about 100x faster than my current desktop.

Thanks guys.

[quote=“Cowie`, post:24, topic:283836”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=375118.msg2828745#msg2828745 date=1245231769]

Fact - Kane is a rent boy.

Someone’s upset because they can’t afford me.
[/quote]
Don’t be so crude, I was talking about you being someone who wishes to rent an item…[/quote]
You bring out the best in me, sweet Cowie. x

Read full topic

item.title: Contemplating Renting this; Opinions? (HP Pav)
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Ollie:

that is a nice laptop, HP are a good make, just look at a few reviews on google before choosing anything

It seems to be quite new, finding a review is proving difficult.

[quote=“T4_, post:16, topic:283836”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=375118.msg2827773#msg2827773 date=1245158545]

Buy a desktop, you will get better hardware for a cheaper price.

I need the mobility. It definitely has to be a laptop.
[/quote]
Then I guess go with the laptop. I suggest installing a Linux distribution with XFCE as the window manager; it will increase battery life, will be faster, will use less processing power.[/quote]
Thanks for your help.

Guess I’ll go with it. I’ve read good and bad things about the card. I’m not a hardcore gamer, so it’s not quite needed for games like Crysis (It can operate fluently on low settings, I think I remember reading) and high on COD4.
Apparently Blu-Ray quality is not laggy, either, so that’s all I’m looking for with the graphics card.

Read full topic

item.title: Contemplating Renting this; Opinions? (HP Pav)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:14, topic:283836”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=375118.msg2827752#msg2827752 date=1245157144]
Buy a desktop, you will get better hardware for a cheaper price.
[/quote]
I need the mobility. It definitely has to be a laptop.[/quote]
Then I guess go with the laptop. I suggest installing a Linux distribution with XFCE as the window manager; it will increase battery life, will be faster, will use less processing power.

Read full topic

item.title: Contemplating Renting this; Opinions? (HP Pav)
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:11, topic:283836”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=375118.msg2827627#msg2827627 date=1245140030]

Big screen. I would be looking to find out how long the battery lasts.

Come with me to Harvey Norman; it’ll be a date. rings Yz

Harvey Norman is a rip off in NZ.

Same in Melbourne. Be careful Kane.

Price on HP website is same as retail price at Harvey. It’s going through Flexirent, anyway.
Not concerned about money, really, as it is only going to be a weekly payment and I get $200 from Centrelink every fortnight. So that’s $100/week I have to rent up too.

This’ll probably be like $30-40/week.
[/quote]Why not build your own computer instead? You can buy the basics and then upgrade when you need more.[/quote]
I need it now + not experienced at all with building computers.

I want a laptop, too.

Read full topic

Well it’s a lot better than your current computer so I’d get it

Would prefer an NVIDIA 9800, but I don’t think that’s an option.
(ps; Get in me, Megan)
